title: Australia's CBA issues $2.5 bln worth subordinated notes - Nasdaq.com
text: Sept 12 (Reuters) - Australia's top lender Commonwealth Bank of Australia   on Thursday said it has issued $2.5 billion worth of subordinated notes.
A number of banks have issued them in recent months after the regulator told lenders they needed to bolster that type of capital, which acts as a buffer during a crisis.
